en.title: How do you want to respond?
en.action: Choose one of the following options.

proceed.heading: Proceeding with the divorce
proceed.summary: If you proceed with the divorce, you won't have to pay any more court fees related to the divorce. You'll be divorced sooner than if you defend the divorce and you usually won't need to attend a court hearing.

proceedButDisagree.heading: Proceeding, but not accepting the allegations
proceedButDisagree.summary:
If you don't agree with what your {{ session.divorceWho }} has said in their divorce application, but you don't want to try to prevent the divorce (you don't want to defend it) you can choose this option. The outcome of the divorce won't be affected if you choose this option.

You won't have to pay any more court fees related to the divorce. You'll be divorced sooner than if you defend the divorce and you usually won't need to attend a court hearing.

defend.heading: Disagreeing with the application (defending)
defend.summary: If you choose to defend the divorce you will have to pay a fee of £{{ feesDefendDivorce }}. You may have to both attend a hearing where a judge will decide if the divorce should be granted.

hardship.heading: Defending the divorce because it will cause you hardship
hardship.text1: As your wife used separation for 5 years as the reason for divorce, you can try to prevent it on the basis that it will cause you severe hardship.
hardship.text2: The hardship could be financial (for example, you'll lose your rights to a widow's pension) or another type of hardship (for example, you'll be stigmatized for cultural or religious reasons).
hardship.text3: You'll need to convince the court that the hardship will be severe.
hardship.text4: The court will take your and your husband's individual circumstances and interests into acccount. It will also take into account the needs of any children if you have any, and anyone else who would be affected by a divorce.
hardship.text5: Severe hardship is rarely used as a defence against divorce, and it's even rarer for the court to reject a divorce application because of it.
hardship.text6: You'll need to make your case for hardship in another form (called the 'answer'). You have 21 days to submit your answer from the date that you sign in to respond to the divorce application.
hardship.text7: You'll also have to pay another £{{ feesDefendDivorce }} fee.

errors.required: Select ‘I will let the divorce proceed’ if you do not want to defend the divorce

proceed.heading: I will let the divorce proceed
proceed.summary: Choose this option if you do not intend to defend the divorce.
proceed.answer: I will let the divorce proceed and won’t try to prevent it (I don’t intend to ‘defend’ it)

proceedButDisagree.heading: I will let the divorce proceed, but I don't accept what my {{ session.divorceWho }} said about me
proceedButDisagree.summary: Choose this option if you don't accept the allegations in the application, but you do not intend to defend.
proceedButDisagree.answer: I will let the divorce proceed (I don’t intend to defend it), but I don’t accept the allegations made in the application

defend.heading: I disagree with the application for divorce
defend.summary: Choose this option if you intend to defend because you don’t agree that your marriage has irretrievably broken down; want to defend yourself against the allegations; or want to make your own application.
defend.answer: I will try to prevent the divorce based on this application (I intend to ‘defend’ it)

proceed.heading: Mynd ymlaen â’r ysgariad
proceed.summary: Os byddwch yn mynd ymlaen â’r ysgariad, ni fydd raid ichi dalu unrhyw ffioedd llys eraill ynglyn â’ch ysgariad. Byddwch wedi ysgaru yn gynt na phe baech yn amddiffyn yr ysgariad ac, fel rheol, ni fydd angen ichi fynychu gwrandawiad yn y llys.

proceedButDisagree.heading: Mynd ymlaen ond heb dderbyn yr honiadau
proceedButDisagree.summary:
Gallwch ddewis yr opsiwn hwn os nad ydych yn cytuno â’r hyn a ddywed eich {{ session.divorceWho }} yn ei gais/chais am ysgariad, ond nad ydych am geisio atal yr ysgariad (nid ydych am ei amddiffyn). Ni fydd dewis yr opsiwn hwn yn effeithio ar ganlyniad yr ysgariad.

Ni fydd raid ichi dalu unrhyw ffioedd llys eraill ynglyn â’r ysgariad. Byddwch wedi ysgaru yn gynt na phe baech yn dadlau yn erbyn yr ysgariad ac, fel rheol, ni fydd angen ichi fynychu gwrandawiad yn y llys.

defend.heading: Anghytuno â’r cais (amddiffyn)
defend.summary: Os byddwch yn dewis amddiffyn  yr ysgariad, bydd rhaid ichi dalu ffi o Â£{{ feesDefendDivorce }}. Efallai y bydd gofyn i’r ddau ohonoch fynychu gwrandawiad lle bydd barnwr yn penderfynu a ddylid caniatáu’r ysgariad.

hardship.heading: Amddiffyn yr ysgariad gan y bydd yn peri caledi ichi
hardship.text1: Gan fod eich gwraig wedi defnyddio gwahanu ers 5 mlynedd yn rheswm dros ysgaru, gallwch geisio atal yr ysgariad ar y sail y bydd yn peri caledi difrifol ichi.
hardship.text2: Gallai’r caledi fod yn ariannol (colli eich hawl i gael pensiwn gwraig weddw, er enghraifft) neu’n galedi o fath arall (eich stigmateiddio am resymau crefyddol neu ddiwylliannol, er enghraifft).
hardship.text3: Bydd angen ichi argyhoeddi’r llys y bydd y caledi’n ddifrifol.
hardship.text4: Bydd y llys yn ystyried eich amgylchiadau unigol a’ch lles ac amgylchiadau unigol a lles eich gwr. Bydd hefyd yn ystyried anghenion unrhyw blant, os oes gennych blant, ac unrhyw un arall y byddai’r ysgariad yn effeithio arno.
hardship.text5: Anaml iawn y defnyddir caledi difrifol yn amddiffyniad dros wrthwynebu ysgariad, ac ni bydd llys yn gwrthod cais am ysgariad am y rheswm hwnnw ond yn anfynych iawn.
hardship.text6: Bydd angen ichi gyflwyno’r ddadl dros galedi ar ffurflen arall (gelwir y ffurflen honno yn ‘ateb’). Mae gennych 21 diwrnod i gyflwyno eich ateb o’r dyddiad y byddwch yn mewngofnodi i ymateb i’r cais am ysgariad.
hardship.text7: Bydd yn rhaid ichi dalu ffi Â£{{ feesDefendDivorce }} arall hefyd.

errors.required: Dewiswch ‘Rwyf am adael i’r ysgariad fynd yn ei flaen’ os nad ydych am amddiffyn yr ysgariad

proceed.heading: Rwyf am adael i’r ysgariad fynd yn ei flaen
proceed.summary: Dewiswch yr opsiwn hwn os nad ydych yn bwriadu amddiffyn ysgariad.
proceed.answer: Rwyf am adael i’r ysgariad fynd yn ei flaen ac nid wyf am geisio ei atal (nid wyf am ei amddiffyn)

proceedButDisagree.heading: Rwyf am adael i’r ysgariad fynd yn ei flaen ond nid wyf yn derbyn yr hyn a ddywedodd  fy {{ session.divorceWho }} amdanaf
proceedButDisagree.summary: Dewiswch yr opsiwn hwn os nad ydych yn derbyn yr honiadau yn y cais, ond nad ydych yn bwriadu amddiffyn yr ysgariad.
proceedButDisagree.answer: Rwyf am adael i’r ysgariad fynd yn ei flaen (nid wyf am ei amddiffyn), ond nid wyf yn derbyn yr honiadau a wneir yn y cais

defend.heading: Rwy’n anghytuno â’r cais am ysgariad
defend.summary: Dewiswch yr opsiwn hwn os ydych yn bwriadu amddiffyn yr ysgariad am nad ydych yn cytuno bod eich priodas wedi chwalu yn anadferadwy; eich bod am eich amddiffyn eich hun yn erbyn yr honiadau; neu eich bod chi am wneud cais.
defend.answer: Rwyf am geisio atal ysgariad ar y sail a roir yn y cais hwn (rwy’n bwriadu ei amddiffyn)
